When I went to school I had a chemistry teacher that told a little story of how he had messed up one time. He had been taking inventory and took the opportunity of topping up the liquids at the same time. So he had got a bit distracted and was thinking of other things when he suddenly realized he was standing there topping up a jar of sodium with water...

He just dove out the door to the corridor and a second or so later it all exploded...

There were some burn marks still visible in the room many years later when he told us about his little mishap. It made us think twice about playing around with it.

Could you try MAKING sodium? Nurdrage has a great video on the process, and it seems quite simple: just mix pure mineral oil, magnesium, lye (sodium hydroxide), and a few menthol crystals, heat to 200C and stir for a few hours, and get huge globs of sodium! I'm trying the process for myself, and it's super cheap and easy.

Day 4 Of asking TKOR to do this experiment
TKOR I have a video idea for you guys please follow these steps * Warning please where gloves these are not going to harm you but digesting it or having to much on your skin may be harmful * Warning also please do not try this at home
Step 1 get 3 glasses of water named cup A, B, C
Step 2 put some ferric chloride about half maybe a little less of a plastic spoon in cup A
Step 3 put some sodium fluoride in cup B about a bit less then half a spoon like 1/3
Step 4 put some potassium thiocyanate in cup C about half a spoon (size doesnt really matter but it works best like this)
Step 5 Stir and mix it well (does not have to be all gone just stir well for like 15 secs)
Step 6 This is the fun part get a spoon of cup A and a spoon of cup C and pour C into A and then it happens
Step 7 Get a spoon of Cup B and pour it in the other spoon
Step 8 Things you can do with this get some of Cup A and put it on a plastic knife and get a rock with some cup C on it and "cut" the rock or anything else hope you like this suggestion if you see this please do this its really cool!
